intro: Eriogonum wrightii var. oresbium, commonly known as the Owens Valley buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, edible seeds that are important for wildlife. The species is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in disturbed soils.
